description.narrative: A recent Value Chain Analysis for the date sector in Hodeida conducted by SPARK(2014) shows that the sector has good opportunities if the following challenges are dealt with: The processes of cultivating, harvesting, storing and processing of local dates in Hodeida seem to be out of date and not matching the changing needs of the market. Therefore, those processes need modernizing and developing. The market governance of the dates value chain is not stable and needs establishment There are several small businesses opportunities that need to be addressed in the date value chain The market awareness and attitude towards the locally produced date is not positive, and so a well-planned campaign is required to establish good impression about the locally produced date Local youth employability is not ready for the labour market, and so youth capabilities need enhancement for the labour market needs. A major obstacle for addressing the previous stated challenging is the lack of the needed knowledge and skills. Therefore, if suitable training and networking is implemented to develop and modernize the dates production processes, for developing and starting small businesses in the dates agri-business sector, improving the target market governance and awareness, and for improving the youth employability skills, positive results are highly expected. As a result of all that, this proposal is addressed to SPARK from FAF hoping to help SPARK achieving their goals of the project.

Project outputs:
1. Project promoted and participants applied for program. 2. Delivery of Capacity Building/Practical growth-oriented training tailored for an organization's level of development, focusing on the knowledge and skills required to manage a growing organization. 3.Assessment organized in needs of companies related to workers skill sets in the dates and selected chain to identify needed skills and training areas; 4.Assessment organized in interests of Yemeni youth and their capabilities and match this with companies in the apprenticeship programme;. 5. Delivery of Business, Technical, and Employability Services to entrepreneurs, existing businesses owners . 6. Matching of Entrepreneurs and existing businesses owners with Financial Institutions. 7.Networking events for the product/employability organized.
Output indicators:
1. 160 young entrepreneurs(50% female) in the dates value chain ,who have received business training, coaching and mentoring. 2. 60 existing business owners (50% female) in the dates value chains, who have received business training, coaching and mentoring. 3. 300 work force (in selected value chains consisting of young women and men and those that pose a particular risk to stability received technical training, coaching and mentoring. 4. 105 (35% of those who have received technical training ) got internship/job placement opportunities within six months after the training with full coaching and support. 5. (25%) of entrepreneurs and existing business owners (who have received training) linked with financial institution to get loans. 6. 3 networking Events 30 participants each.

The direct beneficiaries from Hodeida region of the proposed project will be youth from 18 to 35 years old in three types, hopefully 50% female and 50% male in the totals as in the following: Farmers and current entrepreneurs having the opportunities to develop their enterprises. Unemployed youth with entrepreneurship capabilities for starting-up new SMEs. Unemployed youth in the area, who are seeking job opportunities and who can show readiness to succeed in the labour market.
